data.chText: 使变大 / 变松
data.enText: make bigger/looser

data.chText: 拉长；拽宽；撑大；抻松
data.enText: to make sth longer, wider or looser, for example by pulling it; to become longer, etc. in this way

data.chText: 有什么办法能把鞋撑大吗？
data.enText: Is there any way of stretching shoes?

data.chText: 这件毛衣给撑得变形了。
data.enText: This sweater has stretched.

data.chText: 有弹性（或弹力）
data.enText: to become bigger or longer when you pull it and return to its original shape when you stop

data.chText: 这条牛仔裤有弹性，可以完全贴身。
data.enText: The jeans stretch to provide a perfect fit.

data.chText: 拉紧
data.enText: pull tight

data.chText: 拉紧；拉直；绷紧
data.enText: to pull sth so that it is smooth and tight

data.chText: 把布在架子上绷紧。
data.enText: Stretch the fabric tightly over the frame.

data.chText: 务必要把绳子拉紧。
data.enText: Make sure that the rope is stretched tight.

data.chText: 身体
data.enText: your body

data.chText: 伸展；舒展
data.enText: to put your arms or legs out straight and contract your muscles

data.chText: 他伸了伸懒腰，打了个哈欠。
data.enText: He stretched and yawned lazily.

data.chText: 这些活动目的在于伸展和增强你的腿部肌肉。
data.enText: The exercises are designed to stretch and tone your leg muscles.

data.chText: 伸手够着
data.enText: reach with arm

data.chText: 伸出，伸长（胳膊、腿）
data.enText: to put out an arm or a leg in order to reach sth

data.chText: 她伸手到桌子那头去拿黄油。
data.enText: She stretched across the table for the butter.

data.chText: 我伸出一只手，把书捡起来。
data.enText: I stretched out a hand and picked up the book.

data.chText: 覆盖地域
data.enText: over area

data.chText: 延伸；绵延
data.enText: to spread over an area of land

data.chText: 放眼望去，田野山丘绵延不绝。
data.enText: Fields and hills stretched out as far as we could see.

data.chText: 时间
data.enText: over time

data.chText: 延续
data.enText: to continue over a period of time

data.chText: 该城的历史可以上溯到公元1500年以前。
data.enText: The town's history stretches back to before 1500.

data.chText: 看来谈判十有八九要延续到下个星期了。
data.enText: The talks look set to stretch into a second week.

data.chText: 钱；物资；时间
data.enText: money/supplies/time

data.chText: 足够买（或支付）

before.chText: 用于否定句和疑问句，指一笔钱
before.enText: used in negative sentences and questions about an amount of money

data.enText: to be enough to buy or pay for sth

data.chText: 我需要一辆新车，但我的积蓄不够。
data.enText: I need a new car, but my savings won't stretch to it.

data.chText: （大量地）使用，消耗
data.enText: to make use of a lot of your money, supplies, time, etc.

data.chText: 难民的大量涌入把这个国家的资源消耗殆尽。
data.enText: The influx of refugees has stretched the country's resources to the limit .

data.chText: 我们不能再接受其他工作了——现在已经竭尽所能了。
data.enText: We can't take on any more work─we're fully stretched as it is.

data.chText: 技能；智力
data.enText: sb's skill/intelligence

data.chText: 使竭尽所能；使全力以赴；使发挥出全部本领
data.enText: to make use of all sb's skill, intelligence, etc.

data.chText: 我需要一份让我能充分发挥才智的工作。
data.enText: I need a job that will stretch me.

data.chText: 实情；信条
data.enText: truth/belief

data.chText: 滥用；随意歪曲
data.enText: to use sth in a way that would not normally be considered fair, acceptable, etc.

data.chText: 他承认可能有点言过其实了。
data.enText: He admitted that he had maybe stretched the truth a little (= not been completely honest) .

data.chText: 这出戏的剧情简直就是胡编滥造。
data.enText: The play's plot stretches credulity to the limit .
stretch your legs

data.chText: （久坐之后）散散步，活动活动腿脚
data.enText: to go for a short walk after sitting for some time

data.chText: 我们下了车活动活动腿脚，真不错。
data.enText: It was good to get out of the car and stretch our legs.
stretch a point

data.chText: 破例；通融
data.enText: to allow or do sth that is not usually acceptable, especially because of a particular situation
bend/stretch the rules

data.chText: 根据具体情况改变规则；通融
data.enText: to change the rules to suit a particular person or situation
stretch out
stretch yourself out

data.chText: 躺下（通常为休息或睡觉）
data.enText: to lie down, usually in order to relax or sleep

data.chText: 他在沙发上躺下睡着了。
data.enText: He stretched himself out on the sofa and fell asleep.

data.chText: 土地；水域
data.enText: area of land/water

data.chText: 一片；一泓；一段
data.enText: an area of land or water, especially a long one

data.chText: 一段未破坏原貌的海岸线
data.enText: an unspoilt stretch of coastline

data.chText: 特别危险的路段
data.enText: a particularly dangerous stretch of road

data.chText: 这一河段船只罕见。
data.enText: You rarely see boats on this stretch of the river.

data.chText: 一段时间
data.enText: period of time

data.chText: （连续的）一段时间
data.enText: a continuous period of time

data.chText: 他们工作四小时一班。
data.enText: They worked in four-hour stretches.

data.chText: 她以前看书常常连看几小时。
data.enText: She used to read for hours at a stretch (= without stopping) .

data.chText: 服刑期
data.enText: a period of time that sb spends in prison

data.chText: 他因欺诈罪服刑十年。
data.enText: He did a ten-year stretch for fraud.

data.chText: 身体
data.enText: of body

data.chText: 伸展；舒展
data.enText: an act of stretching out your arms or legs or your body and contracting the muscles; the state of being stretched

data.chText: 我们下车好好舒展了一下身体。
data.enText: We got out of the car and had a good stretch .

data.chText: 要做了准备活动以后再做这些较难的伸展运动。
data.enText: Only do these more difficult stretches when you are warmed up.

data.chText: 保持这个姿势，体会腿部绷紧的感觉。
data.enText: Stay in this position and feel the stretch in your legs.

data.chText: 织物
data.enText: of fabric

data.chText: 弹性；伸缩性
data.enText: the ability to be made longer or wider without breaking or tearing

data.chText: 你需要一种弹性很大的布料。
data.enText: You need a material with plenty of stretch in it.

data.chText: 弹力牛仔裤
data.enText: stretch jeans

data.chText: 跑道
data.enText: on racetrack

data.chText: （终点）直道
data.enText: a straight part at the end of a racing track

data.chText: 终点直道
data.enText: the finishing/home stretch

data.chText: 竞选已进入最后冲刺阶段。
data.enText: The campaign has entered its final stretch.
at full stretch

data.chText: 竭尽全力；以最大财力物力
data.enText: using as much energy as possible, or the greatest possible amount of supplies

data.chText: 各消防队一直在全力以赴。
data.enText: Fire crews have been operating at full stretch.
not by any stretch of the imagination
by no stretch of the imagination

data.chText: 任凭怎么想也不；再怎么说也不
data.enText: used to say strongly that sth is not true, even if you try to imagine or believe it

data.chText: 再怎么说，她也称不上漂亮。
data.enText: She could not, by any stretch of the imagination, be called beautiful.

ex.chText: 商业区/停车区/住宅区
ex.enText: a commercial/parking/residential zone

ex.chText: 危险区/安全区
ex.enText: a danger/safety zone

ex.chText: 地震带
ex.enText: earthquake zones

ex.chText: 他们正把部队调离战区。
ex.enText: They are pulling their troops out of the battle zone.

ex.chText: 中国的大部分地区处于温带。
ex.enText: Most of China is in the temperate zone.

synonyms.bx: 指具有某种区别性特征而被划分出来的区域、地带；用作科技术语时，多指地球上依据温度划分的气候带。

ex.chText: 在澳大利亚还有大片地区至今荒无人烟。
ex.enText: There're large areas in Australia still unpopulated.

ex.chText: 此处禁止停车。
ex.enText: Parking is prohibited in this area.

ex.chText: 我们将在旅馆接待处碰面。
ex.enText: We will meet in the hotel reception area.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指国家、市镇等的区域，或建筑、处所等中作特定用途的场地。

ex.chText: 玉米/森林/绿色地带
ex.enText: the corn/forest/green belt

ex.chText: 《圣经》地带（指美国南部新教教义极具影响的地区）
ex.enText: the Bible Belt

ex.chText: 防护林带能减弱风力。
ex.enText: The shelter belt breaks the force of the wind.

synonyms.bx: 指具有某种特色或某类人居住的地区或地带。

ex.chText: 你知道这个地区的邮政编码吗？
ex.enText: Do you know the postal code of this district?

ex.chText: 北京最热闹的商业区是王府井大街一带。
ex.enText: The busiest shopping district in Beijing is around Wangfujing Street.

synonyms.bx: 多指由政府等机构出于行政管理等目的而明确划分的地区。

ex.chText: 伦敦及（英国）其他各地区
ex.enText: London and the regions

ex.chText: 这些植物生长在阿尔卑斯山区。
ex.enText: These plants grow in the Alpine region.

ex.chText: 山区居民的生活比过去幸福多了。
ex.enText: The inhabitants of mountainous regions live more happily than ever before.

ex.chText: 我去过西班牙的巴斯克区。
ex.enText: I have visited the Basque region of Spain.

synonyms.bx: 通常指界线不明的较大地区或一国的行政分区；the regions 则指某国除首都以外的所有区域。

ex.chText: 我的家乡位于一片美丽的土地上。
ex.enText: My hometown is located on a beautiful stretch of land.

ex.chText: 这一河段少有船只经过。
ex.enText: Ships are rarely seen on this stretch of the river.

ex.chText: 除了近在眼前的一小段路之外，她什么也看不见。
ex.enText: She could see nothing but a small stretch of road just ahead.

synonyms.bx: 尤指长而窄的一片地域或水域。

ex.zh: 在一次拉伸中；在一段时间里

data.enText: stretch your legs

data.chText: （久坐之后）散散步，活动活动腿脚
data.enText: to go for a short walk after sitting for some time

data.chText: 我们下了车活动活动腿脚，真不错。
data.enText: It was good to get out of the car and stretch our legs.
stretch a point

data.chText: 破例；通融
data.enText: to allow or do sth that is not usually acceptable, especially because of a particular situation
bend/stretch the rules

data.chText: 根据具体情况改变规则；通融
data.enText: to change the rules to suit a particular person or situation
at full stretch

data.chText: 竭尽全力；以最大财力物力
data.enText: using as much energy as possible, or the greatest possible amount of supplies

data.chText: 各消防队一直在全力以赴。
data.enText: Fire crews have been operating at full stretch.
not by any stretch of the imagination
by no stretch of the imagination

data.chText: 任凭怎么想也不；再怎么说也不
data.enText: used to say strongly that sth is not true, even if you try to imagine or believe it

data.chText: 再怎么说，她也称不上漂亮。
data.enText: She could not, by any stretch of the imagination, be called beautiful.
stretch out
stretch yourself out

data.chText: 躺下（通常为休息或睡觉）
data.enText: to lie down, usually in order to relax or sleep

data.chText: 他在沙发上躺下睡着了。
data.enText: He stretched himself out on the sofa and fell asleep.

trans: 伸出，伸开（身体的某一部位）

tr: the act of physically reaching or thrusting out
extension to or beyond the ordinary limit
example: by no stretch of the imagination
beyond any stretch of his understanding

tr: exercise designed to extend the limbs and muscles to their full extent
a straightaway section of a racetrack
the capacity for being stretched
a large and unbroken expanse or distance
an unbroken period of time during which you do something
example: he did a stretch in the federal penitentiary

tr: extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body
example: Extend your right arm above your head

tr: extend one's body or limbs
example: Let's stretch for a minute--we've been sitting here for over 3 hours

tr: increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance
example: stretch the soup by adding some more cream
extend the casserole with a little rice

tr: become longer by being stretched and pulled
make long or longer by pulling and stretching
corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance
often by replacing valuable ingredients with inferior ones
extend the scope or meaning of
often unduly
pull in opposite directions
example: During the Inquisition, the torturers would stretch their victims on a rack

tr: lie down comfortably
example: To enjoy the picnic, we stretched out on the grass

tr: extend or stretch out to a greater or the full length
example: stretch out that piece of cloth

tr: occupy a large, elongated area
example: The park stretched beneath the train line

tr: easily stretched

value.def: Something that stretches over an area or distance covers or exists in the whole of that area or distance.

example.ex: The procession stretched for several miles...
example.tran: 游行队伍长达数英里。

example.ex: He had burns that stretched from his neck to his hips.
example.tran: 他从脖子到臀部均被烧伤。

example.ex: ...an artificial reef stretching the length of the coast.
example.tran: 沿着海岸延伸的人造暗礁

value.def: A stretch of road, water, or land is a length or area of it.

example.ex: It's a very dangerous stretch of road...
example.tran: 这是一段非常危险的路。

example.ex: This stretch of Lost River was broader and deeper.
example.tran: 洛斯特里弗的这片水域又宽又深。

example.ex: ...a long stretch of beach with fine white sand.
example.tran: 沙粒又细又白的一大片海滩

value.def: When you stretch, you put your arms or legs out straight and tighten your muscles.

example.ex: He yawned and stretched...
example.tran: 他打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒腰。

example.ex: Try stretching your legs and pulling your toes upwards...
example.tran: 试着双腿伸直并且向上拉伸脚趾。

example.ex: She arched her back and stretched herself.
example.tran: 她弓起背，舒展身体。

example.ex: At the end of a workout spend time cooling down with some slow stretches.
example.tran: 训练结束后花时间做些缓慢的伸展运动来降降温。

example.ex: Make sure no awkward stretching is required.
example.tran: 确定不用做太难的伸展动作。

value.def: A stretch of time is a period of time.

example.ex: He was fluent in French, having spent stretches of time in Southern France.
example.tran: 他曾在法国南部呆过一段时间，法语流利。

example.ex: ...after an 18-month stretch in the army...
example.tran: 在部队生活了 18 个月后

example.ex: He would study for eight to ten hours at a stretch.
example.tran: 他会一口气学习 8 到 10 个小时。

value.def: If an event or activity stretches or is stretched into a further period of time, it continues into that period, which is later than expected.

example.ex: ...as anti-abortion protests stretched into their second week...
example.tran: 随着反堕胎抗议进入第二周

example.ex: The talks could be stretched into the summer of 1993.
example.tran: 该谈判可能会延续至 1993 年夏天。

value.def: If something stretches from one time to another, it begins at the first time and ends at the second, which is longer than expected.

example.ex: ...a working day that stretches from seven in the morning to eight at night.
example.tran: 从早上 7 点持续到晚上 8 点的工作日

value.tran: (从一个时间)持续(至另一个时间)

value.def: If a group of things stretch from one type of thing to another, the group includes a wide range of things.

example.ex: ...a trading empire, with interests that stretched from chemicals to sugar.
example.tran: 从化学制品到食糖均有涉足的贸易帝国

value.def: When something soft or elastic stretches or is stretched, it becomes longer or bigger as well as thinner, usually because it is pulled.

example.ex: The cables are designed not to stretch...
example.tran: 该电缆不能拉伸。

example.ex: Ease the pastry into the corners of the tin, making sure you don't stretch it.
example.tran: 将油酥面团小心地移至烤盘的各角，注意不要把它拉长。

value.def: Stretch fabric is soft and elastic and stretches easily.

example.ex: ...stretch fabrics such as Lycra.
example.tran: 莱卡等有弹性的织物

example.ex: ...stretch cotton swimsuits.
example.tran: 弹力棉制泳衣

value.def: If you stretch an amount of something or if it stretches, you make it last longer than it usually would by being careful and not wasting any of it.

example.ex: They're used to stretching their budgets...
example.tran: 他们习惯于精打细算。

example.ex: During his senior year his earnings stretched far enough to buy an old car.
example.tran: 他上年纪时省下的收入足够买一辆旧车了。

value.def: If your resources can stretch to something, you can just afford to do it.

example.ex: She suggested to me that I might like to start regular savings and I said Well, I don't know whether I can stretch to that.
example.tran: 她建议我可以开始定期存钱，我说我还不知道钱是不是够花呢。

value.tran: 刚能够节约下来(或支付)

value.def: If something stretches your money or resources, it uses them up so you have hardly enough for your needs.

example.ex: The drought there is stretching American resources...
example.tran: 那里的旱灾正在耗尽美国的财力物力。

example.ex: Public expenditure was being stretched to the limit by having to support 3 million unemployed people.
example.tran: 因为要救济 300 万失业人口，公共支出即将被耗尽。

example.ex: The deal will also help the company's stretched finances.
example.tran: 这笔生意也将有助于缓解公司的资金紧张状况。

value.def: If you say that a job or task stretches you, you mean that you like it because it makes you work hard and use all your energy and skills so that you do not become bored or achieve less than you should.

example.ex: I'm trying to move on and stretch myself with something different...
example.tran: 我正想换工作，想尝试点不一样的事情来挑战一下自己。

example.ex: They criticised the quality of teaching, claiming pupils were not stretched enough.
example.tran: 他们批评教学质量太差，声称没有使学生们发挥出潜质。

value.tran: 使竭尽所能;使全力以赴;使拿出全部本领

value.def: If you are at full stretch, your arm is straight and extended as far as possible, usually because you are trying to reach something that is almost too far away.

example.ex: He offered his lighter at full stretch.
example.tran: 他伸长胳膊把打火机递了过去。

value.tran: (通常指为够到某东西而)尽量伸长手臂

value.def: If you are at full stretch, you are using the maximum amount of effort or energy.

example.ex: Everyone would be working at full stretch.
example.tran: 每个人都将全力以赴。

value.def: If you say that something is not true or possible by any stretch of the imagination, you are emphasizing that it is completely untrue or absolutely impossible.

example.ex: Her husband was not a womaniser by any stretch of the imagination...
example.tran: 她老公绝对不是个拈花惹草的人。

example.ex: By no stretch of the imagination could his speech be described as impersonal.
example.tran: 他的演讲再怎么说也不缺乏人情味。

value.tran: 任凭怎么想也(不);再怎么说也(不)

value.def: If you stretch your legs, you go for a short walk, usually after you have been sitting down for a long time.

example.ex: I stopped at the square and got out to stretch my legs.
example.tran: 我在广场处停下来，下车活动活动腿脚。

value.tran: (久坐之后)散散步，活动活动腿脚

value.def: If you stretch a point, you describe something in a way which is not accurate, although it may be partly true.

example.ex: It is stretching a point to call this censorship.
example.tran: 把这称为审查有点儿牵强。

value.tran: 牵强附会;勉强说得过去

trans: 妊娠纹；怀胎纹；纹或称伸张痕；伸展纹
牵张反射；伸张反射；伸展反射；牵张性反射；牵拉反射
